result.execSummary:
The defendant Alexander P. Weittenhiller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Richland County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Conditions:

Must have domestic abuser's class (24-26 week class).  In addition, the Court has suggested anger management but leaves that up to the agent.  Agent must address Defendant's contact with Heather Alderson; agent has the authority to determine if he/she feels "no contact" is appropriate.

Def. to pay costs of the action.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: 14CF55

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alexander P. Weittenhiller

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: emailed request from DOC agent K Schildgen for entry of civil judgment on court costs still owed

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: 1 doc provided by counsel for 2 cases - filed in 14CF55

Defendant Alexander P. Weittenhiller in court with attorney Lisa A. McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer Alleman Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. 

In 14CF55, State moves for amendment of felony escape charge to that of misdemeanor obstructing.  Per DA Harper, the parties have reached an agreement whereby def will plead GNC to the two counts in 14CF55.  In 14CF65, State moves for amendment to misdemeanor bail jumping.  Per DA, joint recommendation of the parties calls for 2 mo jail, all three counts between the two cases consecutive, imposed/stayed for probation of 2 years with anger mgt or d.a. counseling as deemed appropriate by agent; additional conditions as deemed appropriate by agent; agent must specifically address, whatever way agent feels is appropriate, contact with HA; costs.

Court allows the amendments.

Def pleads guilty to both counts in 14CF55 (both now misdemeanors) and to the single count (now also a misdemeanor) in 14CF65.  Court's colloquy re pleas.  Finding of guilty.  DA addresses the Court.  Def addresses Court.

Court adopts probation part of sentence but not the imposed/stayed part; if def is revoked, Court wants an opportunity to consider the facts of the violation, etc.

Court withholds sentence and places def on 2 years probation.  Terms:  Must have d.a. class - required (24-26 week class); Court suggests anger mgt but leaves that up to the agent; agent must address def's contact with HA; agent has the authority to determine if he/she feels no contact is appropriate; pay costs of the action.

Sentence credit:  0 days.
RCSD Dispo of Warrant or Commitment

No contact with Heather Alderson, except thatthe Court will allow contact between Def and HA during the time period of 10 am-12:30 p.m. Sundays at the Westview Methodist Church, however, def not to have direct contact with HA's four-year-old child.

Defendant needs to submit to the Richland County Sheriff's Department for booking as this case was initiated by arrest warrant complaint.
Adjourned initial appearance on December 15, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

DA Harper, Def, and Atty. McDougal for adj. initial and motion to modify court-ordered no-contact prohibition for 14CF55 and initial appr in 14CF65 (case filed by warrant).  

In 14CF55, DA states that the State does not join in the request to modify the no-contact prohibition; statutory victim is in Court and addresses the Court, requesting that the no-contact be dropped.  Victim addresses Court.  Court denies request to modify bond by dropping the no-contact prohibition.

On new case, 14CF65, DA asks for $5k signature bond with no contact with HA.  In 14CF55, Def has a $450 cash bond.

Atty. M addresses the Court - asks for modification of bond to allow def and HA to take part in counseling.

Condition of both bonds (as set this date in 14CF65 and as modified this date in 14CF55):  No contact with H Alderson, except that Court will allow contact between Def and HA during the time period of 10 am -12:30 p.m. Sundays at the Westview Methodist Church, however, def to have no direct contact with HA's four-year-old child.

14CF55 - initial has NOT completed but prelim time limits have been waived.  Next hrg will be adjourned initial for completion of the initial.

14CF65 - initial has not been conducted as defense has just received complaint.  Next hrg will be adjourned initial.

Next date: Monday, Dec. 15 at 1:30.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for 12-15-2014 at 01:30 pm.
